Tucson agreed fully with Perceptor. The hole had to be filled and sealed.  =
At the same time he thought deeply about how to go about it. He did not wan=
t to blast it, but he did need to fill it with something solid.

"Perceptor=
, you're right, we need to fill that hole. I'd rather avoid blasting a miss=
ile down there in risk of doing more damage than good.. Perhaps we can put =
a sizeable seal in that tunnel that would prevent further invasion yet keep=
 everyone safe...  Then after it's sealed we put a control pannel over it, =
and set a code to keep it sealed.  And only those who know that code, will =
have access... It seems like the sensible way of keeping them out and every=
one safe."

He then listens to Cheetor's attitude toward Perceptor, and tha=
t of the other Maximals.  He sighs.

" I did not say any of this would be e=
asy, Cheetor.  You seem to want the easy way out of everything.  I'm sorry =
but life does not usually work that way.  Sometimes you must do something w=
ith great difficulty in order to acheive your goals.  And trusting Percepto=
r will be difficult for you but he is rewarding us with his kowledge and th=
at alone can be priceless."

His tone similar to that of Optimus Prime, Tuc=
son Prime tries his hardest to be patient with the young maximal, knowing t=
hat he too, had been that young vorns ago.  

Night Shift quickly assists i=
n taking care of Rodimus as Rat Trap tries to get the CR chambers functiona=
ble for use. After hearing Tucson Prime's words, he quickly looks over to P=
erceptor and wistles his way.

" Hey, you, Ex Pred, I'm gonna need your sma=
rts over here, if I'm gonna configure the CR chamber properly.  I don't wan=
na mess this up, especially when Rodimus is involved."

Quick Stride guides=
 Tucson into the Ark, not forgetting about his visual impairment.

"Lord El=
der, Sir, whenever the repairs are complete on Rodimus, I believe Tucson Pr=
ime could stand for a few himself.  And so could his visual sensors."
